definition: drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
lit. to beat a gong; fig. to irritate sb/a provocation

pinyin: ting1 hua4 ting1 sheng1 , luo2 gu3 ting1 yin1

definition: opening gong/gong strokes announcing start of opera performance

sentences.english: Drums and gongs were beating boisterously.
People shouted, while the drums and . cymbals crashed incessantly.
sentences.chinese: 人声嘈杂，锣鼓不停地大响特响。

sentences.english: Use drums and gongs , megaphones and recorders to help.
sentences.chinese: 用锣鼓，扩音器和录音机帮忙。

sentences.english: Percussion performances contrast, gag, noise called into play.
sentences.chinese: 表演时锣鼓烘托，插科打诨，喧呼成戏。

sentences.english: With the cheerful deafening sound of gongs and drums, firecrackers, long jump dance.
sentences.chinese: 随着欢快震耳欲聋的锣鼓声，鞭炮声，龙跳跃起舞。

sentences.english: Courtyard 7 is located in central area of Nan Luo Guo.
sentences.chinese: 七号院西餐厅位于市中心的南锣鼓巷地区。

sentences.english: Percussion instrument team members tell reporter, actually they already prepare.
sentences.chinese: 一名锣鼓队队员告诉记者，其实他们早已做好准备。

sentences.english: In the sound of gongs and drums for celebrating rich harvest, you radiate extraordinary splendour of youth.
sentences.chinese: 在欢庆丰收的锣鼓声中，你绽放青春的异彩。

sentences.english: They danced to the accompaniment of cymbals and drums.
sentences.chinese: 他们伴随着锣鼓声跳舞。

sentences.english: Party in a cheerful sound of gongs and drums kicked off.
sentences.chinese: 联欢会在一片欢快的锣鼓声中拉开序幕。
号角声和锣鼓声回荡山谷。

sentences.english: Day camp Cub Scouts practiced to play the Chinese cymbals and drum.
sentences.chinese: 日营幼童军练习演奏中式钹及锣鼓。

sentences.english: To the pounding beat of the drums and cymbals, the dragon began to dance.
sentences.chinese: 锣鼓不住地响着，龙灯开始舞动了。

sentences.english: 5 p.m - A 15-minute walk from Nanluo Guxiang are the city's old drum and bell towers.
sentences.chinese: 从南锣鼓巷步行15分钟即可到达钟鼓楼。

sentences.english: Hark ! I can hear their voices.

sentences.chinese: 它包括两个不同的锣鼓声。

definition: suona, Chinese shawm/see 嗩吶|唢呐
suona, Chinese shawm (oboe), used in festivals and processions or for military purposes/also written 鎖吶|锁呐/also called 喇叭[la3 ba5]
waist drum/waist-drum dance (Han ethnic group folk dance)
watchman's clapper/wooden clappers with bars of unequal length
Yangge, a popular rural folk dance
Tongluo or Tunglo township in Miaoli county 苗栗縣|苗栗县[Miao2 li4 xian4], northwest Taiwan
